pros: Superior upper comfort; Durable; No need to break it in; Superb lockdown; Ample toe box space; Great traction on muddy, boggy, snowy trails; Also comfortable on hard surfaces; Sheds mud easily; Stable and protective midsole; Smooth, enjoyable ride; Best for daily training and trail LSDs
cons: Not as protective for the toes; Does not like to go fast; Can be unstable at fast paces
RR_verdict: Coming off the back of the Pegasus Trail 4’s release, the Wildhorse 8 has had its work cut out to match its road-to-trail counterpart’s phenomenal acclaim. Fortunately for fans of the Nike Trail line, the remodeled v8 delivers in every aspect that matters—getting top marks in comfort, protection, and performance. From our perspective, it’s a no-fuss, wear-it-and-forget-it runner that can confidently traverse long distances even in the roughest of terrains.
awards: Top pick in best Nike shoes for walking and standing all day, Top pick in best Nike trail running shoes
